segments.text: The light coming through the window is so bright and clear.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It illuminates the garden outside, making it look incredibly inviting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost smell the fresh air and blooming plants out there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, the air must be getting humid from all that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sound of the gushing water must be constant now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a stark contrast to the quiet path I see beyond the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The overflowing sink is such an unsightly mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit disgusted by the waste of water too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those children are so precariously balanced.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It just doesn't feel right to see such order outside and chaos within.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole domestic scene is unraveling before my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a strange moment to witness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The simple act of dishwashing has gone completely awry.
segments.speaker: PAR
